content: to sew the ends of the eyelids together @thenickcole 6 tattoos i crocheted the tattoos with surface slip_stitch since this is a tribal thing you can do the tattoos however you want each tribe has its own tattoos so you don t have to do the same ones as me again it s a good idea to mark with pins where you want to crochet along the most important thing for me is that the two sides look roughly the same you can also use the chain stitch to embroider the tattoos or crochet chains that you sew on mark with pins crocheted with surface slip_stitch embroidered with chain stitch finished tattoos @thenickcole 7 if you did the tattoos first go back to page 4 and crochet the gills i thightened the area under the eye insert the thread from the top come out at the purple pin go in again at the yellow one now come out again at the other yellow one go in at the other purple pin and bring the thread out again at the top pull on both ends until the desired effect is achieved secure the ends of the thread arms with tattoo colour make two ch12 turn start in 2nd chain 3slst ch3 turn start in 2nd chain 11slst all the way to the start of the chain sew arms to the sides of the body @thenickcole 8 cap cap colour 1 magic_ring 6sc = 6 2 single_crochet increase *3 = 9 3 2sc increase *3 = 12 4 3sc increase *3 = 15 5 4sc increase *3 = 18 6 5sc increase *3 = 21 7 3sc increase 3sc *3 = 24 8 3sc increase *6 = 30 9 2sc increase 2sc *6 = 36 10 5sc increase *6 = 42 11 3sc increase 3sc *6 = 48 12 7sc increase *6 = 54 13 4sc increase 4sc *6 = 60 14 9sc increase *6 = 66 15 5sc increase 5sc *6 = 72 16 72 single_crochet = 72 i added french knots for the scales before i crocheted the cap and gills together put your cap on the gills the ws facing each other and crochet cap and gills together start at the back using both loops of the cap and only the backloop loop facing you of the gills see picture do not stuff 17 72sc = 72 fo weave in end @thenickcole 9 now add some moss on your cycloom and it is finished i will give you an example of how i did the moss but of course you can crochet it your own way moss moss colour join yarn between cap and gills and crochet with moss green single_crochet 2hdc single_crochet slip_stitch fo weave in ends join yarn on the cap above the other moss and crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet 3dc half_double_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch fo weave in ends as you can see i crocheted moss on different parts of the cycloom s body sometimes using more sts other
